items.excerpt:
In this video, I'll be teaching you how to use the Y-Sort algorithm in Godot Engine to easily create 2D animations. This is a simple tutorial that will help you learn how to use Godot Engine to create 2D animations quickly and easily.

If you're looking for a simple tutorial that will teach you how to use Godot Engine to create 2D animations, then this is the video for you! In this video, I'll teach you how to use the Y-Sort algorithm in Godot Engine to create quick and easy animations. This tutorial is easy to follow and will help you learn how to use Godot Engine quickly and easily!

items.excerpt:
In this Godot Tutorial I talk about the World Environment node and how it can be used to create postprocessing and lighting effects like glow, color correction and adjustment in both Godot 2D and Godot 3D games. The WorldEnviornment is essential to creating cool looking environments and games that stand out. 

Planet Rhythm is a Godot pixel art rhythm game which has unique mechanics and a unique setting for every level!

items.excerpt:
Hey everyone! Welcome to the very first Dauphin Deep Dive - a series where I extract some of the extra-long technical explanations from my devlogs and throw them into their own tutorial segments. In this first episode I walk you through how to use Custom Data Layers in your Godot 4 TileSets and TileMaps.  Hope you enjoy, and let me know what you think of the format!

items.title: Release candidate: Godot 4.0 RC 1

items.excerpt:
The Godot Engine is one of the easier game engines to learn but that doesn't mean there aren't some tips and tricks that are hard to know unless you deep-dive into the documentation.

When working as a game developer, every tip and trick to save yourself time and make your life easier counts.  So I briefly scoured the internet to find some great Godot Engine tricks (Godot 3.5 and Godot 4.0) and baked them up in a nice bite-sized video, so you don‚Äôt have to.

üåê StayAtHomeDev Website - https://stayathomedev.com/?utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=desc&utm_content=13tips

Support the Channel!

üéÆ StayAtHomeDev Discord Server - https://discord.gg/dmYbvFYQRQ
üíõ Level Up+ Your Support - http://patreon.com/stayathomedev

More Videos!

‚úÖ My Dream Game Devlog Series
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NXCN7L7RwJE&list=PLEHvj4yeNfeG_rYcHaHNznViZngQfJ0OB

‚úÖ I Built A Game in Godot 4 While Unreal Loaded
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G6OGM4fdF3M

‚úÖ My First Impressions of the Godot Engine
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FY4L9doIILQ

‚úÖ I Ported My Unreal 5 Prototype to Godot 4
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aeOq8DkyGRo

‚úÖ This Week in Godot (more episodes)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QFvczpBbJHo&list=PLEHvj4yeNfeHArSU6U2a715ssJYYCnKCg

Resources:

Godot - https://godotengine.org/
Godot Documentation - https://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/
Download Godot - https://godotengine.org/download

items.excerpt:
A video in which I talk about the benefits of using the Multi-Mesh instance node in Godot 3.5 and why it works. Spoilers for the video, it's using a rendering technique called "batching" or "batching draw calls".

Buy me a coffee? https://ko-fi.com/wattinteractive

00:00 - Start
00:42 - Some Background - Rendering
01:19 - Krita Example
02:33 - Potential Drawbacks
03:11 - Finally talking Godot specifics

Thanks to StreamBeats by Harris Heller for the music.
items.title: Amazing Performance Gains from 1 node in Godot 3.5

items.excerpt:
In this video we do a speed run creating a simple XR game in Godot using a new template we prepared.
This video is specifically targeted at using Godot at game jams.

Timecodes:
00:00 Download requirements
00:35 Install components
00:55 Create project
01:10 Install export templates
01:35 Godot XR template overview
02:20 Create a new level
03:35 Create our toy gun scene
06:00 Create our foam bullet scene
06:50 Spawning or bullet
07:55 Adding a highlight to our toy gun
08:50 Adding our toy gun to our scene
09:10 Creating a target
10:25 First demo
10:35 Adding sound effects
11:20 Final demo

Disclaimer, it probably took about 3 - 4 hours to actually create the game featured in this video. 
The majority of that time was spend putting the environment together.

Links:
- https://godotengine.org/ - Godot Engine website
- https://github.com/GodotVR/godot-xr-template - The template we are using here
- https://kenney.nl/ - Free game assets from Kenney
- https://freesound.org/ - Free sound assets for your game
- https://godotvr.github.io/godot-xr-tools/ - Documentation about XR Tools

Join this channel to get access to perks:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCrbLJYzJjDf2p-vJC011lYw/join

Follow me on Mastodon or Twitter for regular updates:
https://mastodon.gamedev.place/web/@mux213
https://twitter.com/mux213
items.title: Creating a Godot XR game in 12 minutes.
